revised_title: Melanoid Tapeta Lucida in Teleost Fishes: Chemical Composition and Distribution
tldr: This study examines the presence and chemical composition of melanoid tapeta lucida in various teleost fish species. The researchers found that these tapeta contain a compound consisting of oligomers of 5,6-dihydroxindole-2-carboxylic acid combined with decarboxylated-adenosylmethionine. The tapetum lies in the retinal pigment epithelium and is enclosed within tapetal spheres. The study also discovered a red pigment in the pigment epithelium of some characins, which is apparently the same as New Zealand parrotfish red pigment.
